text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness because we should have repented to You wholeheartedly so that You would return to us in compassion.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 16_Chapter,: If one could ask of another: "Give over your son to eat" but he's already hidden, sliced into slices...
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because you provided us with the manna, the well and the pillar of clouds;
Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness when we recall the proclamation, 'You are witnesses, and I am God!'
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: And scream for their blood, spilled like water through her canals.
And scream for the desolate assemblies, and for her Sanhedrin that no longer exists....
Scream for the cheers of her despisers as her corpses multiplied.
Scream for the tittering of her dancers, whose silence now fills her cities.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours, is the shamefacedness, because on the day (we made the Golden Calf), we brought it an offering of fine flour with oil and honey.
and, ours is the shamefacedness, because we blasphemed Hashem in (the Wilderness of) Sin (when we demanded of Aaron), 'Arise and create a god for us!'
and ours is the shamefacedness, because of the hypocrisy to be found within us as we emulated (Egypt's abominable) deeds.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: Scream for the torment and the blows that her monks suffered.
And scream for her babies, their skulls cracked open upon the rocks.
Scream for Zion and her cities like a woman giving birth, and like a bride dressed in mourning for her husband on her wedding night.
Scream for her princes, her noble Children of David.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness because we defied You as Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab as related (by Moses),
Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because You have taken (our) nation from amidst another nation, with miracles;
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: And scream for the oppressor who replaced her dresses with sacks.
Scream for the joy of her haters as they laughed at her wounds.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness, because they (our forefathers) rebelled on the shore of the Sea of reeds, the nation sinning against its God!
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 16_Chapter,: If daughters could be dandled in the breasts of their mothers, distended bellies...
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness because of Achan who appropriated for himself from the forbidden spoils (of Jericho) and found no excuse (for his crime).
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: And scream for the excitement of her cursers from within her sacred courts.
Scream for Your name that was desecrated by her besiegers.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness because (Daniel) the man of delights pleaded with You (to end the Babylonian Exile after a mere seventy years, even though we were not worthy,) saying, 'Incline Your ear, O my God, and hear!'
Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because God went out to redeem us as a people unto Himself;
Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because of (how You waged war for us with) Sihon and Og and all the kings of Canaan;
Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because of all that You accomplished through the fourteen saviors(-Judges);
Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because You fed us (the manna) that tasted like dough fried in honey;
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 16_Chapter,: If the tongue of a nursing baby could glue to his palate from blinding white thirst...
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness because the evil in our midst caused each one's destruction, and in their loss, we have been humiliated.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: Scream for God’s exiled servants, who beautifully sang her melodies.
Scream for the castle abandoned, by fault of the sheep who make up her flock.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: and ours is the shamefacedness because our forefathers grumbled in their tents about (the manna and called it) the destructive bread.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 16_Chapter,: If the fine locks of their heads could be shorn and bound as decorations for horses...
If the ghosts of children, bloated with rot, floated in the streets of the city...
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: And scream for their beauty, extinguished the moment they removed her crowns.
And scream for the torture of her pure and noble citizens.
Scream for the dignity that vanished when they destroyed her shrines.
And scream for the prayers that they will shout: Heed and listen to her words.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because in the wilderness we lacked for nothing;
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: And scream for God’s despisers, who violated the sanctity of her chambers.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 16_Chapter,: If women so full of compassion could boil their children, measured hand height by hand height...
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because You erected (Tabernacles) at Shiloh, Nob, Gibeon and the Eternal Temple (in Jerusalem);
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: And scream for the desecrated palace vessels, and the altar for her incense.
Scream for Zion and her cities like a woman giving birth, and like a bride dressed in mourning for her husband on her wedding night.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because although the Destructions of the two Temples were caused by our corruption, we ourselves were spared;
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 16_Chapter,: If one could sigh one to another: "Come on and let's boil our screeching sons...
If fathers, now meat, could be seasoned for their sons in caves and trenches...
If women could eat the fruit of their womb, the little babes clapping their hands...
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because of the (almost) nine centuries throughout which You withheld Your anger (over our sins) and didn't broadcast it;
and ours is the shamefacedness because of Micah's idol through which we transgressed.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 44_Chapter,: Scream for her constant sacrifices and her redeemed first born.
Scream for the crimes that she committed as she paved the way for her iniquity.
And scream for her myriad burned and blackened communities.
text.1_Kinot for Tisha B'Av Day, 18_Chapter,: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness, because of the wondrous signs You have displayed from then until now;
and ours is the shamefacedness, because of the trial with which You sought to refine us, (but as a result of our failure) You despised us.
